greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total length of transient and terminal cycle if unitary-proper-divisor-sum function f(x) = A063919(x) is iterated and the initial value is n. Number of distinct terms in iteration list.
comment: This sequence implements the original definition given for A097032.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..87360
example: For n = 1, A063919(1) = 1, that is, we immediately end with a terminal cycle of length 1 without a preceding transient part, thus a(1) = 0+1 = 1.
For n = 2, A063919(2) = 1, and A063919(1) = 1, so we end with a terminal cycle of length 1, after a transient part of length 1, thus a(2) = 1+1 = 2.

For n = 30, A063919(30) = 42, A063919(42) = 54, A063919(54) = 30, thus a(30) = a(42) = a(54) = 0+3 = 3, as 30, 42 and 54 are all contained in their own terminal cycle of length 3, without a preceding transient part.
program: A034460(n) = (sumdivmult(n, d, if(gcd(d, n/d)==1, d))-n); \\ From A034460
A318882(n) = { my(visited = Map()); for(j=1, oo, if(mapisdefined(visited, n), return(j-1), mapput(visited, n, j)); n = A063919(n)); };
A318882(n) = { my(visited = List([]), k); for(j=1, oo, if((k = pil(n,visited)) > 0, return(j-1)); listput(visited, n); n = A063919(n)); };
xref: Cf. A002827 (the positions of ones after the initial 1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2018, after _Labos Elemer_'s A097032
